Message.Title: Here's What Happens Next
Message.Msg: It will hit 290 again, perhaps even $300. Once it breaks through $300, it will never trade lower, ever. IBD said AMZN gave a buy signal today. IBD is consistently right. So tomorrow morning I will buy with everything in my account, which is presently all cash. And I have margin capability, so I can buy almost twice as much as if it was just a cash account. AMZN is so far ahead of all other online retailers, that no one will ever catch up. No one. Jeff Bezos is the Henry Ford of our generation. AMZN is the next AAPL, except it will never correct by 40% like AAPL did. AMZN will never correct by more than 3-4%; how could it? AAPL had an absurd valuation and compressing margins and market share. AMZN is reasonably valued and has healthy and growing margins and expanding market share. And don't even get me started about cloud services, streaming videos, etc. Holy cow, AMZN is cleaning up here, too. I could write for hours about the virtues of AMZN the company and AMZN the stock, but I think you get my general drift. Oh, and I forgot to mention the outstanding dividend yield. That seals the deal. And no one really cares about sales tax anyways; they pay it on in-store purchases, so paying tax on online purchases is no problem at all. It makes AMZN just like everyone else, which is a great thing for customers and for shareholders alike. No brainerest stock ever.

Message.Msg: Sybs: You are wrong about what I purchased and when, but there's no question that the puts have been crushed. I underestimated the lengths to which certain institutions would go to protect the scam which is destined to collapse (because the underlying economics are f'd). The Fed and the entire financial sector are "all in" trying to perpetuate their parasitic tax on productive enterprise in the US and running the biggest propaganda campaign in history. Hitler would blush... But, they will fail. Trust is gone and everyday people are moving out of financial assets subject to the WS tax into real assets. The predators are about to go extinct, they just don't realize it yet. You think you will win by being short for the downstroke, but TPTB cannot allow asset deflation. The banks would have to realize losses and go bankrupt. Half of WS would be gone quickly and the other half would see pay cut in half. All the "Masters of the Universe" would find themselves unable to support the lifestyle and cost structure to which they've become accustomed on OPM. They HAVE to find a way to get inflation... Ultimately, they will find there is only one way to accomplish that -- through USD getting crushed (without which nominal wages cannot grow due to global competition, without which nominal asset values cannot be supported by cash flows...). The key LT will be to understand who wins and loses when the system comes back into balance. This scam will get absolutely CRUSHED. There will be many a case study on this scam someday (plus the ever helpful probing questions of analysts and firms AFTER the damage has been done). Best, Tech
